alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Deaf Smith County through 845 PM CDT... At 737 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of Glenrio to near Broadview. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Simms, Glenrio and Bootleg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
